Package com.cafean.rpc

Class RPCListener

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.cafean.rpc.RPCManager
      • com.cafean.rpc.RPCListener
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CalcServerListener, JobStatusListener, ModelEditorListener
    public class RPCListener
extends RPCManager
implements java.lang.Runnable
    This class implements the server side "listener" for the CAFEAN RPC system. Once initialized, the RPCListener listens on the specified port for new incoming connections and spawns RPCResponders to manage those connections.

    The client side "connector" is implemented by RPCOriginator.

    See Also:
    RPCResponder

    • Constructor Detail

      • RPCListener

        public RPCListener​(java.lang.String name,
                   java.lang.String ioPackage,
                   int port)
        Creates a new listener for the given port.
        Parameters:
        ioPackage - a String containing the path of the package containing the PibBlock classes that will be used as remote commands by this listener.
        port - the port that this listener will listen on

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        public void initialize()
                throws java.io.IOException
        Initializes this listener based on the properties provided to the constructor.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the server socket cannot be initialized
        java.lang.IllegalThreadStateException - if called when already initialized

      • shutdown

        public void shutdown()
        Requests that this listener shutdown ASAP by interrupting the incoming task thread.
        Overrides:
        shutdown in class RPCManager

      • run

        public void run()
        The main processing loop for this RPCListener. This method continuously polls its server socket for new incoming connections and spawns RPCResponder instances for each one.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable

      • isAlive

        public boolean isAlive()

      • toString

        Overrides:

      • getPort

        public int getPort()
        returns the port that this listener is listening on

      • findResponder

        public RPCResponder findResponder​(java.lang.String id)
        Returns the responder with the given ID
        Parameters:
        id - a String containing the unique id of the responder
        Returns:
        the RPCResponder or null if none is found

      • isLocal

        public boolean isLocal​(java.net.Socket socket)
        Returns true if the given socket is a local connection. A local connection is a connection for which the local side's address includes "127.0.0.1" and both sides have the same IP address (i.e. same InetSocketAddress).
        Parameters:
        socket - the Socket to evaluate
        Returns:
        true if the socket is a local connection
        See Also:
        Socket.getLocalSocketAddress(), InetSocketAddress.getAddress()
